intro: Hieracium lesianum, commonly known as the Lesianum hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia, particularly in mountainous regions. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. Hieracium lesianum is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it is often found in alpine or subalpine environments.
